text: by using AWS Robin Hood has been able to
build highly sophisticated systems with
an incredibly small team I'm miles
Welsley I head of Business Development
at Robin Hood Robin Hood is an
investment platform that offers free
trades for everyone our two co-founders
uh had been working on a trading firm
and they noticed that for all their
institutional investors trades were
essentially free and the technology and
the cost of placing a trade is
effectively close to zero they would go
back to their own brokerage accounts to
help brokerage accounts and they would
have to pay up to $10 a trade they
thought we can create a brand new type
of brokerage firm where we can create an
incredibly efficient lean organization
and then pass those savings onto the
average investor we launched in March of
2015 we've been the fastest growing
Brokerage in history we had a weight
list of over a million people and so we
needed to get up and running fast and
scale our systems as a product oriented
customer first company it was important
for us to concentrate on the product and
build a customer experience that people
love build an app that people love to
use that was simple to understand so it
was great that we didn't have to
concentrate on building out the
infrastructure to support that and that
we could leverage AWS to help us scale
this business as quickly as we needed to
when you submit your application to
Robin Hood you can sign up for a
brokerage account in under 4 minutes and
that's just unheard of usually you'd
have to like fill out paper documents
get notorized we review that application
and occasionally will need to reach back
out to the customer for say an ID or
letter from their firm's compliance
Department we can prompt the customer
through our app to upload that document
directly to S3 in a secure way so we can
have our registered principles be able
to quickly make a decision as to whether
or not to open that account and have all
the relevant information available to
them being able to Leverage The Power of
AWS we had two devops people who were
able to scale the entire system which
was just critical for us in terms of
getting up and running with AWS we use
18 different Services what's nice is a
lot of the features that are important
to us such as security permissions
scaling monitoring all that comes very
nicely baked in from a compliance and
security perspective AWS identity and
access management has been incredibly
helpful as we have worked to narrow the
scope of permissions that various
services and people have access to helps
us control the data and information that
is shared throughout the platform
another uh service that's been
incredibly helpful for us is red shift
as we've grown we've had a limited data
science team and instead of having to go
out and recruit an entire data science
infrastructure team we've been able to
help our data scientists concentrate on
writing the queries that are necessary
for us to do things like identify fraud
on the platform uh fight money
laundering as a broker dealer when there
are Market events or during the market
open or Market close we see huge spikes
in load on the systems and it's very
nice that we're able to rely on AWS to
help us manage that traffic as it comes
in since we launched uh We've saved our
customers over $22 million in
commissions over a billion dollars has
been transacted on the platform we're up
to almost 40 employees now as a small
growing company it's been really helpful
for us to optimize our time in terms of
how we are able to look at the real-time
analytics and the behaviors that are on
our platform that really wouldn't be
available uh at our scale if we weren't
using
[Music]
AWS
